Shadow Priest Mythic+ Guide

11.0.7 - The War Within

Last Updated:December 17, 2024|Changelog|FAQ

Welcome to the Shadow Priest Mythic+ guide for the World of Warcraft patch 11.0! This guide covers everything you need to know to understand your character! Are you starting out and leveling up from 70? Check out the leveling guide!

Overview

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Shadow Priest
Shadow PriestMythic+
Single-Target
Strong
AoE
Strong
Utility
Average
Survivability
Average
Mobility
Subpar

Hero Talents

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Shadow Priest
  • ‍Archon     is better in most extended fights compared to
    ‍Voidweaver    , making it the choice for all high end content like push Mythic+ keys or most Mythic raid bosses.
    ‍Voidweaver     is great for lower key levels and also fights that have absorb shields.
‍Archon
‍Voidweaver
  • ‍Halo     is empowered by
    ‍Power Surge    , causing it to be recast every 5 seconds.
    • You gain a
      ‍Surge of Insanity       every time you create a
      ‍Halo      .
      • You gain a total of 3
        ‍Surges of Insanity        .
    • Your enemies take 2% more damage every time they are hit by
      ‍Halo      , stacking up to 5.
    • You can choose to have your
      ‍Halo       slow enemies by 5% every time they are hit by it, stacking up to 5.
    • Your
      ‍Halo       now comes back after it reaches it maximum distance hitting enemies an additional time.
  • Your cooldowns are empowered:
    • Your
      ‍Power Infusion       gives you 10% additional haste.
    • You deal more damage in
      ‍Dark Ascension       or
      ‍Void Eruption      .
  • Your
    ‍Mind Flay: Insanity     and
    ‍Mind Spike: Insanity     do 60% more damage.

Whenever you use your

‍Void Torrent you summon an
‍Entropic Rift that does damage around your target, this rift explodes at the end of its duration doing damage to enemies in it and it has further synergies with some of the hero talents.

  • Your
    ‍Entropic Rift     transforms your
    ‍Mind Blast     into
    ‍Void Blast    , making it do more damage and generate more insanity.
  • Each
    ‍Devouring Plague     you cast empowers your rift's size and damage by 20%.
  • You have a choice between
    ‍Void Empowerment     and
    ‍Darkening Horizon    .
    • ‍Darkening Horizon       is currently undertuned and isn't picked in any scenario.
    • ‍Void Empowerment       is the better option in every situation currently.
  • Passive shadow damage increase with
    ‍Voidheart    .

‍Dark Energy is really useful for movement.
‍Devour Matter is really strong against shielded mobs.

Talents

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Shadow Priest
‍Archon Void Eruption
‍Voidweaver Dark Ascension

When to use this Spec

Use this spec in higher Mythic+ keys.

‍Void Eruption performs better when enemies stay alive for longer periods of time.

Gameplay Altering Talents

Discover all talents that significantly alter your gameplay within the Spec and Class Talent trees. This section gives a concise overview of these talents and their applications but for a more detailed look check out the Rotation and Deep Dive sections below.

Spec Tree

  • ‍Shadow Crash
    • Makes it easy for you to dot up to 8 targets.
  • ‍Void Torrent
    • A good 30 minute burst cooldown.
  • ‍Mind's Eye
    • Synergizes very well with
      ‍Surge of Insanity      , giving you more procs for less Insanity.
  • ‍Void Eruption
    • Your main damage cooldown, paired with
      ‍Power Infusion      .
  • ‍Psychic Link
    • Makes your single target spells do damage to every other target affected with
      ‍Vampiric Touch      .
  • ‍Shadowy Insight
    • Chance to grant a charge of
      ‍Mind Blast       and makes the next cast instant.
  • ‍Mental Decay
    • Extends your
      ‍Vampiric Touch       and
      ‍Shadow Word: Pain       when you use
      ‍Mind Flay       or
      ‍Mind Flay: Insanity      .
  • ‍Surge of Insanity
    • Currently this is one of your biggest damage sources, should always aim to not overcap on stacks.

Class Tree

  • ‍Halo
    • One of the main damaging cooldowns of the spec and required for the hero talents to work.
  • ‍Twist of Fate
    • Increases your execute damage.
  • ‍Phantom Reach
    • Increases the range of most of your spells.
  • ‍Power Infusion
    • One of your main damage cooldowns.
  • ‍Shadow Word: Death
    • Your main damaging spell in execute.
    • Also enhanced by
      ‍Death and Madness       and
      ‍Tithe Evasion      .
  • ‍Vampiric Embrace
    • Strong utility cooldown for off healing, usually paired with
      ‍Void Eruption      .

Hero Talents

  • ‍Sustained Potency
    • As of 11.0.5 and the changes they made to this talent, allowing you to pause your
      ‍Void Eruption       or
      ‍Dark Ascension       when outside of combat this will be the go-to talent, especially lower key level dungeons.
  • ‍Word of Supremacy
    • Default pick since it increases your survivability all the time.
  • ‍Shock Pulse
    • Can be changed to
      ‍Incessant Screams       if the group comp is lacking CCs.

When to use this Spec

Use this spec in the low to mid-range of Mythic+ keys.

‍Dark Ascension is a shorter cooldown, increasing your damage for more packs throughout the dungeon and doesn't rely on being extended like
‍Void Eruption, making it more valuable when enemies die fast. Additionally you have a very powerful 30 second window with your void torrent.

Talent Adjustments

Listing all the changes within the Class and Spec tree compared to the default build.

Spec Tree

  • Added
    • ‍Dark Ascension
      • 1 minute cooldown that increases your non-DoT damage.
    • ‍Deathspeaker
      • A proc that resets the cooldown of shadow word: death and makes it do full damage even when the target is below 20%.
    • ‍Insidious Ire
      • Passive damage increase to mind blast and void torrent when you have all 3 dots up on your target.
    • ‍Mastermind
      • Passive damage increase.
  • Removed
    • ‍Auspicious Spirits
    • ‍Tormented Spirits
    • ‍Idol of Yogg-Saron

Hero Talents

Changed

‍Archon to
‍Voidweaver for more info visit the Hero Talent section above.

  • ‍Dark Energy
    • Your default pick because you don't have to stop channeling your Void Torrent if you have to move out of mechanics.
  • ‍Voidwraith
    • Currently outperforms
      ‍Depth of Shadows      .
  • ‍Embrace the Shadow
    • Good passive shield,
      ‍Void Leech       can be used when there's a lot of physical damage in the fight.

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Shadow Priest

Tier Set

  • 2-Set: The duration of
    ‍Devouring Plague     is increased by 1 second.
  • 4-Set:
    ‍Devouring Plague     increases your damage done by 2% for 10 seconds, multiple applications may overlap.

Single-Target

‍Archon
‍Voidweaver

  • Your goal of your opener is to spend all charges and use all of your relevant abilities as efficiently as possible. Below you can find an example of how your opener should look like:

    ‍Vampiric Touch     unless it was already applied by
    ‍Shadow Crash    .
  • Use your active trinkets,
    ‍Tempered Potion    ,
    ‍Power Infusion     and racials like
    ‍Blood Fury     or
    ‍Berserking     after using
    ‍Void Eruption    .
  • Make sure you are never overcapping on
    ‍Mind Flay: Insanity    .

This is a general priority you aim to maintain throughout the fight.

  1. Keep up
    ‍Vampiric Touch     on your target.

      ‍Mental Decay      ,
      ‍Void Bolt       and
      ‍Shadow Crash      .

    ‍Shadowfiend    .

    ‍Halo    .

    ‍Power Infusion

    ‍Devouring Plague     on the target.
  7. Cast
    ‍Void Bolt    .
  8. Cast
    ‍Mind Flay: Insanity     if you are about to overcap on stacks.
  9. Cast
    ‍Mind Blast    .
  10. Cast
    ‍Void Torrent    .
  11. Cast
    ‍Mind Flay: Insanity    .
  12. Cast
    ‍Shadow Word: Death     if the target is below 20%.
  13. Cast
    ‍Mind Flay    .

Deep dive

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Shadow Priest

Min Maxing
‍Void Torrent

When it comes to

‍Void Torrent there are a couple of conditions you need to consider before pressing it:

  1. Having at least 1
    ‍Mind Blast     on cooldown. (If you are playing
    ‍Voidweaver     you should have 1
    ‍Mind Blast     ready and the second one should be on 4-6 seconds remaining.)
  2. Having
    ‍Void Bolt     on cooldown (if in
    ‍Void Eruption    ).
  3. Having
    ‍Devouring Plague     up on the target for the increased mastery benefit.
    • This can be ignored if inside of
      ‍Void Eruption       and you don't have
      ‍Insidious Ire       talented.
    • If you have
      ‍Insidious Ire       talented you should have
      ‍Devouring Plague       up on the target no matter if inside
      ‍Void Eruption       or not.

Here is an example of how to maximize your damage with

‍Void Torrent:

‍Mastery: Shadow Weaving and
‍Devouring Plague

The Shadow Priest's mastery is very important to play around. It makes it so that every DoT you have on the target increases your damage done by your mastery %, which makes your mastery management vital.

‍Vampiric Touch and
‍Shadow Word: Pain are up on the target nearly 100% of the time, this leaves you with the task of maintaining
‍Devouring Plague on the target. Having as high uptime as possible on
‍Devouring Plague is crucial to dealing the highest possible damage. During your
‍Void Eruption you gain the maximum effect of your mastery no matter the DoTs on the target.

Spreading
‍Devouring Plague

With the current tier set it is no longer a DPS gain to Spread your

‍Devouring Plagues.

  • A good example of when you should spread it is on Fangs of the Queen in City of Threads.
  • A bad example would be spreading it on the small adds on Tred'ova in Mists of Tirna Scithe instead of using all of your
    ‍Devouring Plagues     on the boss.

Understanding Mechanics

Rotational min-maxing is just one aspect of mastering a specialization, but there are numerous other key mechanics that influence your performance. Use the following guides to improve them.

  • Pandemic
  • Spell Queue Window
  • Stat Diminishing Returns

Boss Tips

Avanoxx

  • Use
    ‍Desperate Prayer     or
    ‍Dispersion     on
    ‍Alerting Shrill     and the
    ‍Gossamer Onslaught    .
  • Avoid kiting Starved Crawlers into the boss else the boss receives
    ‍Insatiable    .
    • Keep your
      ‍Shadow Crash       so you can instantly dot them and kill them.
  • Try to have some instant cast spells like
    ‍Devouring Plague     for when
    ‍Gossamer Onslaught     is happening so you can continue dpsing on the move.

Anub'zekt

  • Use your
    ‍Angelic Feather     to dodge the
    ‍Burrow Charge     when you are targeted by it.
  • Kill Bloodstained Webmages fast and interrupt
    ‍Silken Restraints    .
  • Use
    ‍Desperate Prayer     or
    ‍Dispersion     when you have the
    ‍Infestation     debuff.

Ki'katal the Harvester

  • Use defensive while you're affected by
    ‍Cultivated Poisons     since it hits like a truck!
  • When you're affected by
    ‍Grasping Blood     you can use any form of crowd control instead of killing it to cancel your root.

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • ‍Resonant Barrage       from Trilling Attendant.
    • ‍Horrifying Shrill       from Ixin.
    • ‍Revolting Volley       from Bloodstained Webmage.
    • ‍Venom Volley       from Blood Overseer.
  • Pay extra attention to these casts:
    • ‍Alarm Shrill       from Sentry Stagshell
      • A really long cast that needs to get disrupted.
    • ‍Massive Slam       from Nerubian Hauler and Hulking Bloodguard
      • A short stun that ramps in damage done per cast.

Boss Tips

Orator Krix'vizk

  • You can
    ‍Mass Dispel     the
    ‍Shadows of Doubt    , but be careful because it can be very deadly.
  • Use your defensives during
    ‍Vociferous Indoctrination    .
  • ‍Angelic Feather     helps you dodge and move with the tank easier.
    • Make sure you also save some Insanity and have some instant casts so you can do full damage on the move.

Fangs of the Queen

  • Watch out for
    ‍Knife Throw    . Use defensives if you're targeted by this ability.
  • You can either dispel
    ‍Ice Sickles     with
    ‍Mass Dispel     or use
    ‍Fade     to remove it.
  • Use your defensives on
    ‍Rime Dagger     and
    ‍Duskbringer    .

The Coaglamation

  • Use your defensives for
    ‍Dark Pulse    . This happens at 100 boss energy.

Izo, the Grand Splicer

  • Use your defensives for
    ‍Splice     since it's the highest damage event during this fight.
  • Use your
    ‍Shadow Crash     to quickly dot all the Scarabs.

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • ‍Web Bolt       from Sureki Silkbinder.
    • ‍Grimweave Blast       from Covert Webmancer.
    • ‍Mending Web       from Covert Webmancer.
    • ‍Twist Thoughts       from Herald of Anurek.
    • ‍Void Wave       from Sureki Unnaturaler.

Boss Tips

E.D.N.A.

  • Always stack up to spawn
    ‍Volatile Spikes     close together to ensure you can detonate them all with 1
    ‍Refracting Beam    .
    • Use
      ‍Desperate Prayer       whenever it's ready for this ability.
  • Use
    ‍Dispersion     for
    ‍Earth Shatterer    .
  • Utilize your
    ‍Mass Dispel     to dispel
    ‍Seismic Reverberation     off of your tank.
    • Dispel it right before
      ‍Seismic Smash       to give your tank the 50% damage reduction from
      ‍Stone Shield      .

Skarmorak

  • Dot only the Crystal Shard that you are currently attacking otherwise you will get a lot of stacks of
    ‍Crystalline Eruption    .
  • Use your defensive before
    ‍Unstable Crash     happens or while you have multiple stacks of
    ‍Unstable Energy    .

Master Machinists Brokk and Dorlita

  • Interrupt
    ‍Molten Metal     with
    ‍Silence     whenever he jumps away.
  • Use your defensive during
    ‍Exhaust Vents     and
    ‍Blazing Crescendo    .

Void Speaker Eirich

  • Pre position yourself to a portal so you can quickly get rid of
    ‍Entropy     from
    ‍Entropic Reckoning    .
  • Use your defensive on
    ‍Entropic Reckoning    .

Trash Tips

  • Focus down
    ‍Earth Burst Totem     from Cursedforge Stoneshaper. They have a low amount of health but are not affected by AoE abilities.
  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • ‍Howling Fear       from Ghastly Voidsoul.
    • ‍Censoring Gear       from Turned Speaker.
    • ‍Piercing Wail       from Void Bound Howler.
    • ‍Restoring Metals       from Forgebound Mender and Cursedforge Mender.
    • ‍Arcing Void       from Cursedheart Invader.

Boss Tips

Speaker Shadowcrown

  • Consider using a defensive if you're affected by
    ‍Collapsing Night    . Getting out of this quickly is important since it deals a lot of damage every 0.5 seconds.
  • You can use
    ‍Mass Dispel     to dispel
    ‍Burning Shadows    .
  • Interrupt
    ‍Shadow Bolt    .

Anub'ikkaj

  • Stun
    ‍Animate Shadows     with
    ‍Shadowfury    .
  • Use defensives for the
    ‍Dark Orb     and
    ‍Shadowy Decay    .
  • Save your
    ‍Shadow Crash     for
    ‍Animate Shadows    .

Rasha'nan

  • Be aware of
    ‍Erosive Spray    . It applies
    ‍Lingering Erosion     which is dangerous when combined with other damage events.
  • Consider using a defensive when you get
    ‍Expel Webs     as your mobility is quite bad and you can't deal with them as well as some other classes can.

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • ‍Night Bolt       from Nightfall Shadowmage.
    • ‍Ensnaring Shadows       from Nightfall Shadowmage.
    • ‍Tormenting Beam       from Nightfall Darkcaster.
    • ‍Umbral Barrier       from Nightfall Darkcaster.

Boss Tips

Ingra Maloch

  • Interrupt
    ‍Spirit Bolt     every time a non-tank player is targeted.
  • Try to line up your cooldowns with Droman Oulfarran's
    ‍Droman's Wrath     to gain a huge DPS boost. This happens when Droman Oulfarran reaches 20% health.
  • Interrupt
    ‍Spirit Bolt    .

Mistcaller

  • Use your
    ‍Shadow Crash     to quickly apply your dots to the Illusionary Clones and the Illusionary Vulpin.
  • Use your defensives during the
    ‍Guessing Game    .

Tred'ova

  • Use your
    ‍Shadow Crash     to quickly apply dots to the Glooming Larvas.
  • Make sure you position yourself far from the tank so you don't get
    ‍Mind Link    .

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • ‍Spirit Bolt       from Drust Harvester.
    • ‍Harvest Essence       from Drust Harvester.
    • ‍Nourish the Forest       from Mistveil Tender.
      • You can use your
        ‍Mass Dispel         to remove the buffs from the enemies.
    • ‍Bramblethorn Coat       from Mistveil Shaper.
      • You can use
        ‍Dispel Magic         and
        ‍Mass Dispel         to purge it if it goes through.
    • ‍Stimulate Regeneration       from Spinemaw Staghorn.
    • ‍Stimulate Resistance       from Spinemaw Staghorn.

Boss Tips

Blightbone

  • Use your
    ‍Desperate Prayer     or
    ‍Dispersion     if you're targeted by
    ‍Heaving Retch    .
    • Make sure to always dispel the disease that it leaves behind with
      ‍Purify Disease      .
  • Always use
    ‍Shadow Crash     on Carrion Worms.

Amarth, The Harvester

  • ‍Shackle Undead     either the Reanimated Crossbowman or Reanimated Mage if you're not planning on killing them quickly.
  • Interrupt the
    ‍Necrotic Bolt     or the
    ‍Frostbolt Volley     from the Reanimated Mage.

Surgeon Stitchflesh

  • Make sure you have your
    ‍Shadow Crash     whenever a new Creation is coming or when the boss is being hooked.
  • Use defensives on
    ‍Stitchneedle    .

Nalthor the Rimebinder

  • You can use your
    ‍Leap of Faith     on a the target of
    ‍Dark Exile     to let the player stay up and not have to go down.
    • Do note that you still die after 50 seconds after doing this. It's a gain if the boss has low health or the targeted player could struggle in the extra phase.
    • Don't do it if you have 0 combat resurrections ready!
  • Consider pooling some insanity for the
    ‍Icebound Aegis     as it can be very dangerous in higher keys!

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • ‍Drain Fluids       from Corpse Harvester and Corpse Collector.
    • ‍Necrotic Bolt       from Zolramus Sorceror & Zolarmus Necromancer.
    • ‍Rasping Scream       from Skeletal Marauder.
    • ‍Frostbolt Volley       from Reanimted Mage.
      • You can use your mass dispel to dispel it if it goes through.
    • ‍Goresplatter       from Corpse Collector.
      • You can use your
        ‍Purify Disease         to dispel it if it goes through.
    • ‍Repair Flesh       from Flesh Crafter.

Boss Tips

Chopper Redhook

  • Line up your cooldowns with the boss walking over Bombs which afflict him with
    ‍Heavy Ordnance    .
  • Make sure you have your
    ‍Shadow Crash     for when the adds spawn.

Dread Captain Lockwood

  • Focus down the Ashvane Cannoneer during the phase change to quickly use
    ‍Unstable Ordnance     to get the boss down from the ship.
  • Make sure you have your
    ‍Shadow Crash     for when the adds spawn. (at 66% and 33% of boss hp).

Hadal Darkfathom

  • Consider pressing a defensive on the
    ‍Break Water    .
  • Make sure to have some instant cast spells for when you are about to move for
    ‍Crashing Tide    .

Viq'Goth

  • Use your
    ‍Mass Dispel     to help your healer dispel
    ‍Putrid Waters     during the fight.
  • Make sure to have both of the tentacles dotted with
    ‍Vampiric Touch    .

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • ‍Brackish Bolt       from Irontide Waveshaper.
    • ‍Watertight Shell       from Irontide Waveshaper.
    • ‍Water Bolt       from Bilge Rat Tempest.
    • ‍Choking Waters       from Bilge Rat Tempest.
    • ‍Bolstering Shout       from Ashvane Commander.

Boss Tips

General Umbriss

  • Use your
    ‍Desperate Prayer     or
    ‍Dispersion     before
    ‍Commanding Roar    .

Forgemaster Throngus

  • Use your
    ‍Desperate Prayer     during
    ‍Blistering Heat    .
  • Use your
    ‍Dispersion     when you are targetted by
    ‍Molten Spark
    • and
      ‍Blistering Heat       is also happening.

Drahga Shadowburner

  • Use
    ‍Desperate Prayer     or
    ‍Dispersion     during
    ‍Twilight Buffet    .
  • Make sure to have your
    ‍Shadow Crash     ready for when the
    ‍Invocation of Shadowflame     spawn.

Erudax, the Duke of Below

  • Use defensives during
    ‍Abyssal Corruption     and
    ‍Void Surge    .
  • Make sure to always have your
    ‍Shadow Crash     for the Mutated Hatchlings.
    • Be careful of killing them too quickly as when they die they leave a debuff that increases your shadow damage taken and the
      ‍Void Surge       might be deadly then.

Defensive Usage can be found in this timeline:

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • ‍Earth Bolt       from Twilight Earthcaller.
    • ‍Mass Tremor       from Twilight Earthcaller.
      • You can use your mass dispel to remove it.
    • ‍Shadowflame Bolt       from Twilight Beguiler.
    • ‍Sear Mind       from Twilight Beguiler.

Affixes

The Affix system got revamped going into The War Within Season 1 retiring most Affixes as well as introducing new kiss-curse ones while also changing on which key level these appear.

  • +2 Affixes -- Rotates on a weekly basis
    • ‍Xal'atath's Bargain: Ascendant
    • ‍Xal'atath's Bargain: Voidbound
    • ‍Xal'atath's Bargain: Oblivion
    • ‍Xal'atath's Bargain: Devour
  • +4 Affixes -- Alternates between each other on a weekly basis
    • ‍Tyrannical
    • ‍Fortified
  • +7 Affix
    • ‍Challenger's Peril
  • +10 Affixes -- Alternates between each other on a weekly basis, is always the opposite of the +4 Affix
    • ‍Tyrannical
    • ‍Fortified
  • +12 Affix
    • ‍Xal'atath's Guile       -- Replaces the +2 Affix

Following you get some useful tips for handling different Mythic+ Affixes as a Shadow Priest.

  • ‍Xal'atath's Bargain: Ascendant
    • ‍Mass Dispel       works but it is capped to 5.
    • ‍Psychic Scream
  • ‍Xal'atath's Bargain: Voidbound
    • Switch to the affix and kill it as soon as it spawns as it gives damage reduction to the rest of the mobs.
    • ‍Shadow Word: Death       is very powerful against this mob because it spawns at 1 hp with a big shield, especially when playing
      ‍Devour Matter      .
  • ‍Xal'atath's Bargain: Oblivion
    • Collect the orbs moving towards the enemy mobs.
  • ‍Xal'atath's Bargain: Devour
    • ‍Mass Dispel       is very powerful as it can cleanse your entire team.
    • ‍Purify Disease      .

Stat Priority

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Shadow Priest

Understand your secondary stat priority and the tertiary stats needed for optimal performance during Mythic+ dungeons as a Shadow Priest. For more detailed information, visit the Stats and Attributes guide.

Higher Item level items are better in most scenarios. For an accurate representation of what item to equip you should use Simcraft! A static "Stat Priority" is just a starting point and can easily shift depending on your individual gear.

All secondary stats are affected by diminishing returns. Click here to learn more!

Tertiary

  • Avoidance - Great stat to reduce the damage intake of "Area of Effect" abilities.
  • Leech - Provides additional healing through damage dealing. The damage of your pets does not heal you thus Leech is a great tertiary for you since most of your damage is coming from your own spells.
  • Speed - Niche tertiary that can be very useful and has been proven useful in the past. Makes playing certain mechanics a lot easier.

Farmable Alternatives

Below you are presented with a good list of farmable alternatives that are obtainable outside of WoW’s weekly lockout system. While replaced in time as you progress, these offer immediate character power.

Trinkets

Below you can find active and passive alternatives to our recommended trinkets. Do note that some trinkets are better than others depending on the mythic+ dungeon.

Active Trinket alternatives

  • ‍Treacherous Transmitter
    • Treat this as a 2 minute trinket, syncing it up with you cooldowns.

Passive Trinket alternatives

  • ‍Gale of Shadows
    • Very good option for a passive trinket, giving you passive intellect.
  • ‍Ovi'nax's Mercurial Egg
    • Good option if the fight/dungeon allows you to stack it up.
  • ‍Empowering Crystal of Anub'ikkaj
    • Decent option.

Embellishments

  • 2x
    ‍Dawnthread Lining
    • This is similar to Dragonflight's
      ‍Blue Silken Lining      , except it's 80% hp and it gives Critical Strike instead of Mastery.

Remaining Sparks

  • Crafted items are 636 item level and regular items are 639 on max item level therefore it's not beneficial to equip crafted items outside of your 2x embellishments unless you don't have access to other high item level gear on that slot.

Simcraft

To find the best combination of gear available to you or identify the best possible upgrades, visit our Simcraft guide to learn how to utilize Simcraft easily and effectively.

Races

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Shadow Priest

For min-maxing a Shadow Priest in Mythic+, different racial traits can provide a tremendous benefit to your character. If this is not your top goal, picking a race that fits your style works just as well.

  • ‍Stoneform     -- Dwarf
    • One of the most potent racials in Mythic+ currently and historically.
    • Dispels Magic and Bleed debuffs.
  • ‍Shadowmeld     -- Night Elf
    • Also one of the most potent racials in Mythic+ historically.
    • Use-cases
      • Run past basically any mob and then cast
        ‍Shadowmeld         to make them reset. Even works on mobs that have stealth detection if you get enough distance before you
        ‍Shadowmeld        .
  • ‍Blood Fury     -- Orc
    • Strong racial for damage both because of
      ‍Command       and
      ‍Blood Fury       which lines up with
      ‍Void Eruption      .
    • 20% reduced Stun duration on you which can be useful in some Mythic+ dungeons.
  • ‍Escape Artist     -- Gnome
    • Free yourself from roots.
  • ‍Rocket Jump     -- Goblin
    • Do a small jump in the direction your character is facing.
    • While you're in the
      ‍Rocket Jump       animation you are placed on a global cooldown until your character lands.

Recommendation

‍Dwarf and
‍Night Elf abilities have such a big impact on your Mythic+ experience that you need to use either of them if you're serious about pushing keys with your Shadow Priest.

Macros

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Shadow Priest

Discover recommended macros for Shadow Priests during Mythic+ dungeons and watch a quick video guide on creating simple macros for your character.

Macro Import Guide Video

Cursor Macros

‍Shadow Crash -- Casts
‍Shadow Crash on your cursor without confirmation. 

#showtooltip 
/cast [@cursor] Shadow Crash

‍Mass Dispel -- Casts
‍Mass Dispel on your cursor without confirmation. 

#showtooltip
/cast [@cursor] Mass Dispel

Mouseover Macros

‍Vampiric Touch -- Casts
‍Vampiric Touch on your mouseover or target.

#showtooltip 
/cast [@mouseover,exists] [] Vampiric Touch

‍Purify Disease -- Casts
‍Purify Disease on your mouseover or target.

#showtooltip 
/cast [@mouseover,exists] [] Purify Disease

Utility Macros

Angelic Feather on player - Uses your

‍Angelic Feather on your feet.

#showtooltip
/cast [@player] Angelic Feather

Cancelaura

‍Dispersion - Cancels your
‍Dispersion without having to wait a gcd.

#showtooltip Dispersion
/cast Dispersion
/cancelaura Dispersion

Addons

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Shadow Priest

Below, you see a screenshot of the author's User Interface for their Shadow Priest, outlining which addons are used and how they are utilized in Mythic+ dungeons to make your life easier.

Addons

  • ElvUI -- Full User Interface replacement
    • A user interface designed around user-friendliness with extra features that are not included in the standard UI.
    • Alternatively, you can also use Shadowed Unit Frames (SUF) and an action bar addon of your choice or of course the stock UI.
  • LittleWigs -- Generic Boss Mod
    • BigWigs is a boss encounter add-on. It consists of many individual encounter scripts, or boss modules; mini add-ons that are designed to trigger alert messages, timer bars, sounds, and so forth, for one specific Raid encounter.
  • WeakAuras -- Jack of all trades
    • WeakAuras is a powerful and flexible framework that allows the display of highly customizable graphics on World of Warcraft's user interface to indicate buffs, debuffs, and other relevant information. This addon was created to be a lightweight replacement for Power Auras but has since introduced more functionalities while remaining efficient and easy to use.
  • Plater -- Advanced Nameplates
    • Plater is a nameplate addon with an extraordinary amount of settings, out of the box debuff tracking, threat coloring, and support for scripting similar to WeakAuras and wago.io + the WeakAuras-Companion for Mod/Script/Profile updates.
  • Details -- In-depth Damage Meter
    • Most powerful, reliable, handsome, damage meter.
  • OmniCD -- Party track addon
    • Helpful addon for Mythic+ to check the available cooldowns of your party.

WeakAuras

Vampiric Touch Missing

Shows if you are missing Vampiric Touch on any enemies in the pull.

Changes this Patch

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Shadow Priest

Patch 11.0.5

PRIEST

  • Power Word: Fortitude now costs 1% base mana (was 4%).
  • Hero Talents
    • Archon
      • Sustained Potency has been updated – It now also pauses the duration of Apotheosis, Dark Ascension, or Voidform for up to 20 seconds while out of combat or affected by a loss of control effect.
      • Fixed an issue causing Cyclone and similar effects to prevent Halos from Power Surge from firing.
      • Fixed an issue causing Halo to not be castable during Divine Ascension.
    • Voidweaver
      • Entropic Rift now has a hostile variant for PvP combat, so you can differentiate it from a friendly Entropic Rift.
      • Entropic Rift now displays a low-noise version for your allies, instead of being completely invisible

Patch 11.0.2

  • Priest
    • ‍Flash Heal       healing increased by 20%.
    • ‍Power Word: Shield       absorb amount increased by 20%.
    • ‍Power Word: Life       healing increased by 20%.
    • ‍Cauterizing Shadows       healing increased by 60%.
    • Healing done from
      ‍Void Shift      to the Priest’s ally is now capped at twice the Priest’s Health.
    • ‍From Darkness Comes Light       now increases the healing of
      ‍Flash Heal       by 3% (was 1%), and stacks up to 20 times (was 50).
    • ‍Prayer of Mending       is now removed from all allies except for the last ally that received one from the Priest when a raid encounter begins.
    • Fixed an issue causing
      ‍Holy Nova       to not benefit from Phantom Reach.
    • Fixed an issue causing
      ‍Halo       to damage enemies out of combat.
    • Updated the visuals and animations for
      ‍Void Shift      .
    • Fixed an issue causing
      ‍Divine Image's       teleport to fail on transports.
    • Added a counter to the Heal spell for tracking the status of
      ‍Lightweaver      .
    • The following talents are now 1 point:
      • ‍Manipulation
      • ‍Surge of Light
  • Shadow
    • All damage increased by 3%.
    • ‍Dark Ascension       now increases non-periodic damage dealt by 20% (was 25%).
    • ‍Mind Flay      damage increased by 50%.
    • ‍Mind Flay: Insanity       now channels the same amount of damage over 1.5 seconds (was 2 seconds).
    • ‍Mind Flay: Insanity       and Mind Spike: Insanity can now accumulate up to 4 charges (was 2).
    • The overrides for
      ‍Mind Flay: Insanity       and Mind Spike: Insanity now last 30 seconds (was 15 seconds).
    • ‍Mind Spike       damage increased by 50%.
    • ‍Mind Flay: Insanity       damage increased by 15%.
    • ‍Mind Flay: Insanity       now generates 12 Insanity (was 8).
    • ‍Mind Blast       damage increased by 30%. Void Blast damage is unaffected by this change.
    • ‍Mind Melt       now stacks up to 3 times (was 4).
    • Mind Melt now increases the critical strike chance of
      ‍Mind Blast       by 30% (was 20%).
    • ‍Mind Flay      and Mind Sear from Idol of C'Thun now deal damage 10 times over their channel's duration (was 15).
    • ‍Mind Flay      and Mind Sear damage from Idol of C'Thun increased by 50%.
    • Fixed an issue causing
      ‍Psychic Link       to not always hit when near the max range of its effect.
    • Fixed an issue causing the targeted version of
      ‍Shadow Crash       to not follow a moving target.
    • Fixed an issue causing Void Lashers and Void Tendrils from
      ‍Idol of C'Thun      to fail to attack sometimes.
    • Fixed an issue causing Void Lashers and Void Tendrils from
      ‍Idol of C'Thun       to attack enemies the Priest is not in combat with.
    • ‍Divine Star       no longer generates Insanity when cast out of combat.
    • ‍Shadow Crash       now refunds its Insanity gain if it doesn't deal damage to any targets when cast out of combat.

Patch 11.0

  • Priest:
    • All talent trees have had many talents move locations or have had their pathing updated.
    • New Talent:
      ‍Cauterizing Shadows       – When your
      ‍Shadow Word: Pain       or
      ‍Purge the Wicked       expires or is refreshed with less than 5 seconds remaining, a nearby ally within 40 yards is healed.
    • New Talent:
      ‍Phantom Reach       – Increases the range of most spells by 15%.
    • ‍Manipulation       has been redesigned – Now causes you to take 1%/2% less damage from targets affected by
      ‍Shadow Word: Pain      ,
      ‍Purge the Wicked      , or
      ‍Holy Fire      .
    • ‍Power Word: Life       healing increased by 15%.
    • ‍Void Tendrils       now root targets for 15 seconds (was 20 seconds).
    • ‍Power Word: Shield       and
      ‍Luminous Barrier's       absorb values now have a 5% variance, like other healing spells.
    • The following talents have been removed:
      • Mindgames (moved to PvP talents)
      • Shattered Perceptions
  • Shadow
    • ‍Mind Flay: Insanity       now deals damage every 0.5 seconds for 2 seconds (was every 0.75 seconds for 3 seconds).
    • ‍Mind Flay: Insanity       now generates 12 Insanity over its duration (was 16).
    • ‍Void Torrent       damage increased by 30%.
    • ‍Shadow Crash       is now a choice node with an option to have it be cast on your target.
    • Fixed an issue causing the range of
      ‍Psychic Link      to not be increased by
      ‍Phantom Reach      .

FAQ

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Shadow Priest

Why do I keep dying?

Make sure to always pre-use your

‍Fade and
‍Protective Light when you don’t have your
‍Desperate Prayer or
‍Dispersion ready.
